laboratory_examinations.findings: Hemoglobin level of 17.5 g/dL; otherwise normal WBC and platelet counts.
Initial PaO2 of 38 mm H2O while breathing 3 L of O2; oxygen saturation increased to 88% while breathing 50% O2.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: During hospitalization, PaO2 level noted to be 48–52 mm H2O while breathing room air.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased uptake in the brain, salivary glands, thyroid, enlarged spleen, kidneys, and intestines; confirmed presence of pulmonary shunt.
Confirmed hepatitis C virus infection; negative for HIV, cryptococcal, and toxoplasma infections.
Extensive piecemeal necrosis consistent with chronic hepatitis; confirmed diagnosis of cirrhosis.

laboratory_examinations.date: Four months after initiation of treatment
laboratory_examinations.findings: Baseline oxygen saturation increased to 95% while breathing room air; resolution of platypnea and orthodeoxia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Oxygen saturation did not appreciably change (94%–97%) during moderate exercise.
